title: Unit 3 Sec 6: Circulatory System
description: Covers cardiac anatomy, heart failure types, MI management, and shock.

questions.question: Which of the following are specific signs of **Left-Sided** Heart Failure? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Left-sided failure backs up into the lungs (Respiratory symptoms). Right-sided failure backs up into the body (Ascites, Liver, Peripheral Oedema).

questions.question: What is the acronym for the immediate management of a Myocardial Infarction?
Trace the path of blood through the heart starting from the Body:
questions.explanation: Body -> Right Heart -> Lungs -> Left Heart -> Body.

questions.question: Which blood type is considered the Universal Donor?
questions.explanation: Group O has no antigens on the cell surface, so it can be given to anyone (specifically O negative).

questions.question: Ventricular Fibrillation is a medical emergency requiring immediate defibrillation.
questions.explanation: Ventricular fibrillation results in zero cardiac output and requires immediate shock (defibrillation) to restore rhythm.
